name: Charged Boulder
description: Ammo for catapult. Big boulder filled with iron splinters, charged with meteor core's energy. Designed to shred wood to pieces and severely damage even the sturdiest materials.

name: Iron-Tipped Bolt
description: Ammo for Ballista. An iron tip easily penetrates armor and makes holes in bodies that can't be patched.

name: Iron Studded Boots
description: Most tribes eschew iron armor, despite its protective value. History has proven that it is not pirates whom a nomad must fear most, but the sun.

name: Iron Studded Gauntlets
description: Most tribes eschew iron armor, despite its protective value. History has proven that it is not pirates whom a nomad must fear most, but the sun.

name: Iron Studded Armor
description: Most tribes eschew iron armor, despite its protective value. History has proven that it is not pirates whom a nomad must fear most, but the sun.

name: Split Durable Water Sack
description: A huge water bag worn on the back with two separate compartments.

name: Water Circulator
description: This insulating suit traps excreted fluids and recycles them with state-of-the-art worm technology.

name: Lava
description: Historically believed to be the remains of nomads who were burnt by the Sun, it's been recently discovered to be useful in various productions of fuels, bombs, and other items.

name: Contaminated Water
description: The red tint is attributed to a ubiquitous variety of toxic algae.

name: Lava Fuel
description: Being almost as hot as lava itself, it's often used in combat and crafting.

name: Tar
description: Thick liquid used in heavy and complex constructions. Ignitable in combination with other materials.

name: Nomad Cloth
description: A tightly woven cloth that is hard to cut and nearly waterproof. The Flotillan standard.

name: Blood Turnip
description: The wandering wisemen use a divining technique to locate the rare blood turnip root, which when cut open bleeds like a slaughtered animal. Many have tried without success to cultivate it.

name: Cactus Flesh
description: The last resort for nomads dying of thirst. At least the taste won't kill you.

name: Huge Cactus Fruit
description: Some strange plants with psychoactive properties can be turned into mind enhancing vitamins.

name: Chitin Plate
description: Skittering parasites make their nests between the gooey cracks. Harvesting chitin is dirty work.

name: Clay
description: Extracted from lakebed soil.

name: Flots
description: Currency of the Flotilla. Can be withdrawn and deposited at any Trading Station.

name: Large Base Walker Packer
description: Allows to pack a single walker of any type. Requires a foundation of a base to support itself.

name: Small Base Walker Packer
description: Allows to pack a single small walkers up to a Dinghy type. Requires a foundation of a base to support itself.

name: Ammo Chest
description: When placed on a walker, weapons will use the ammo from the chest to reload. Placing in a base will only allow to store ammo.

name: Base Maintenance Chest
description: A requirement for every Nomad's base. Prevents a base decaying over time with sufficient resources inside. Requires each resource a base is made of to properly maintain it.

name: Gigantic Chest
description: Stack size: 500. An extremely strong chest with a very large amount of inventory space. Items are protected unless the chest is severely damaged.

name: Large Chest
description: Stack size: 300. A very strong chest with a large amount of inventory space. Items are protected unless the chest is severely damaged.

name: Medium Chest
description: Stack size: 200. A sturdy chest with a moderate amount of inventory space. Items are protected unless the chest is severely damaged.

name: Obsidian Canister
description: Extremely durable, large container resistant to highest temperatures.

name: Obsidian Pot
description: Extremly durable container resistant to highest temperatures.

name: Large Water Bag
description: Store large volumes of liquid. Liquid is protected unless the container is severely damaged.

name: Medium Water Bag
description: Store moderate volumes of liquid. Liquid is protected unless the container is severely damaged.

name: Small Water Bag
description: Store small volumes of liquid. Liquid is protected unless the container is severely damaged.

name: Fiberworking Station
description: Basic crafting station manufactures fabrics for walker sails and armors.

name: Advanced Fiberworking Station
description: Advanced crafting station manufactures fabrics more efficiently.

name: Lumbermill
description: A huge crafting station uses torque to turn logs into tons of wood. Extremely efficient.

name: Obsidian Machine
description: With parts carved out of solid obsidian, the machine can safely hold lava to use it in various productions.

name: Repair Station
description: Basic crafting station repairs damaged equipment at a lower cost than crafting new ones.

name: Soil Excavator
description: Basic crafting station extracts different types of soil from the ground, like sand from the desert, or with more advanced knowledge, clay from mud puddles.

name: Stomping Station
description: Basic crafting station simulates the blunt force of a foot to crush vegetables and soft minerals. An important tool for nomads who must always keep their feet in top condition.

name: Water Condenser
description: Collects moisture from the air and stores it as clean water. Efficiency depends on the area where the condenser is built.

name: Purification Station
description: All water that is transported to the Flotilla is cleansed in an ancient water purifying machine. The Guardians are the sole keepers of this machine, a technological relic of the old world which has sustained the Flotillans to this day. However, nomads developed a similar, yet more primitive version of this technology.

name: Windmill
description: Harnesses wind to generate torque automatically. A torque belt is required to transfer the torque between devices.

name: Advanced Woodworking Station
description: Advanced crafting station unlocks new available recipes and cuts wood more efficiently.

name: Artificer Woodworking Station
description: Artificer crafting station unlocks all available recipes and is the most efficient woodworking station.

name: Furnace
description: Advanced crafting station smelts raw ore into refined metal.

name: Quarry
description: A huge crafting station uses torque to automatically mine stone, iron and other minerals within a certain radius.

name: Vision Powder
description: Said to induce hallucinations that can reveal ancient wisdom. Grants Nomad the ancient wisdom to build a Walker.

name: Desert Mule
description: These refreshing eye drops deceive a Nomad into thinking his or her heatstroke is gone. Allows Nomad to carry more weight.

name: Sinus Destroyer
description: Snorting this will make a Nomad hyper focused. Grants Nomad more damage and faster reloading with board weapons.

name: Fury Fumes
description: A bottle of gas that when inhaled infuses a Nomad with rage. Increases Nomad's damage with melee weapons, but also increases damage received.

name: Jojo Mojo
description: A swirling mixture that makes a Nomad burst into song and dance. Negates all falling damage taken by Nomad.

name: Race Dust
description: Makes a Nomad want to race other Nomads. Allows Nomad to sprint without losing stamina.

name: Rupu Repellent
description: A malodorous perfume that makes every other living creature want to run away. Reduces rupu aggressiveness toward Nomad.

name: Worm Tincture
description: An extremely potent essence of worm secretion that grants Nomads vivid memoirs of the events long forgotten. Get XP upon consumption. Drinking at max character level grants +1 attribute point.

name: Bonebreaker
description: A small injection that may cause balance loss and serious injury from falling off walkers. Grants Nomad double damage after a successful block.

name: Exoskeleton
description: Using repeater ammo to shoot,  this feat of engineering was created on the Flotilla and can be packed into Walker Packing Compartments. Protects nomads wearing them and allows to carry and operate heavy weapons and tools.

name: Table
description: Decorative furniture that also allows to place objects on it.

name: Hammock
description: A simple bed with a small water container that, when filled, allows a couple respawns.

name: Cauterizing Station
description: Quickly heals by cauterizing fresh wounds. Requires a vitamin to be added in order to work.

name: Sterile Bandage
description: Restores a large amount of HP over a period of time. Not usable while in combat.

name: Poaching Hut
description: A placeable that creates a mini-claim area in moderate radius. Additional resouces will go into this placeable instead of Proxy Walker.

name: Primitive Bandage
description: Restores a small amount of HP over a period of time. Not usable while in combat.

name: Bed
description: Comfortable bed with a big water container to hold multiple respawns.

name: Rangefinder
description: Measures distance to far-away targets.

name: Sand
description: Tiny green mineral flecks dot the sand.

name: Feather
description: Migrating flying creatures serve as one of the oldest compasses for lost nomads, like dark arrowheads sailing toward the next oasis.

name: Fiber
description: Used to make everything from ropes, sails, to garments.

name: Fiber Weave
description: A crude fabric woven from strands of natural fiber.

name: Insects
description: Its extremely hard carapace evolved to shield it from extreme weather.

name: Fiery Concoction
description: A mixture of ingredients with dashes of wood splinters kept in secret by the nomadic outlaws. Used in production of Hellfire Bolts to make fire burn at extremely high temperatures, allowing to damage even the strongest materials.

name: Bone Glue
description: Rapidly bonds after application. Discovered by a Flotillan cook who stewed powdered bones of an unknown creature into his soup broth. The nomads he served died of asphyxiation.

name: Magma Seeds
description: Thrives in the heat generated by volcanic hotspots.

name: Earth Wax
description: Nomads rely on earth wax to waterproof walker sails and make their wooden decks resistant to decay. Often found when mining rocks, it can also be extracted from some natural resources through pressure.

name: Glass
description: A transparent material

name: Meteor Core
description: Strange crystal that exudes an almost mesmerising glow. If you listen closely, you can hear a steady humming noise emanating from its energized interior.

name: Flint
description: A sharp mineral, handy for the production of primitive blades and extra pointy sticks

name: Nibiran Mineral
description: This inconspicuous rock glows brightly when the Moon and Sun align. The mineral has permeated the soil, water, plant life, and possibly more.

name: Hide
description: The raw skin of an animal.

name: Iron Ingot
description: Extremely strong material used in high quality productions.

name: Iron Ore
description: Over the centuries, nomads have experimented with iron in the construction of their walkers and armor. However, in the race to outrun the sun, it was those who travelled lightest that survived longest.

name: Nibiran Ingot
description: Iron ingot coated with scraped off green mineral of unkown origin.

name: Obsidian
description: Molten rock flowed across the world's surface, and the metropolises were buried.

name: Peculiar Corundum
description: A strange, slightly translucent stone without a single scratch on the surface or other traces of deterioration. It seems to have endured many burnouts quite unscathed.

name: Salt Rock
description: Mined from desert salt lakes.

name: Sulfur
description: A yellow mineral that typically forms in sulfur lakes.

name: Rupu Gel
description: Rupu Gel is highly flammable, and a sideproduct of a shamanic ritual. A rare ingredient used in crafting ammo and often traded in Trade Stations.

name: Pearl
description: In the dry southern valleys, the fossils of old sea creatures litter the ground, turning the hills white.

name: Aloe Vera
description: This hardy plant grows in the hottest of conditions.

name: Apple
description: Crisp and delicious. No worms guaranteed.

name: Cattail
description: An abundant marsh plant favoured by nomads for its medicinal properties.

name: Corn
description: Corn is seeded by expeditionary planters on the fringe of the Ice Lands.

name: Cotton
description: Grows in open meadows.

name: Mushroom Flesh
description: Make a meal out of it, or a bomb.

name: Lava Poppy
description: Requires high concentrations of volcanic ash to grow.

name: Red Banana
description: Looks delicious, tastes HORRIBLE.

name: Reinforced Plank
description: Strong wooden plank reinforced using a forgotten technology at Ancient Crafting Sites.

name: Toothwheel
description: A simple yet elegant mechanism used in the transfer of power

name: Walker Mechanism
description: Masterfully crafted contraption that automatically releases energy and bolsters transmission of walker gear mechanisms. Essential in construction of heavier walkers.

name: Rope
description: A strong cord used for crafting and construction

name: Rupu Pelt
description: Garments made from this oily fur are favoured for voyages into the Ice Lands.

name: Rupu Vine
description: These vines grow exclusively in rupu excrement, which the rupu use as a binding agent in the construction of their mud huts.

name: Thornberry
description: Grows inside a notoriously dangerous, bulbous plant. The thornberry has mystical properties and is said to have appeared with the arrival of Nibiru.

name: Torque
description: Torque Consumption

name: Wood Shaft
description: The Rupu are skilled imitators, and can crudely reproduce human fighting techniques and constructions. They use wood shafts to prop up their mud huts, giving them a striking resemblance to the Nomads' walkers.

name: Ash
description: A product of burning wood.

name: Bent Wooden Planks
description: Produced using a much more wasteful method of log processing than simple lumber, bent planks are significantly more sturdy and don't require any other materials.

name: Charcoal
description: Burns hotter in a furnace than normal wood.

name: Lightwood
description: A type of very light wood with a porous structure and air trapped between the layers of the fiber.

name: Wood Log
description: Manufactured at a lumber mill.

name: Redwood Wood
description: A harder, more sought after wood used for specialty constructions.

name: Toxic Remains
description: The leftovers of a shamanic ritual.

name: Wood
description: This versatile material is the focus of Flotillan engineering.

name: Weightless Module
description: Stacking this module decreases the weight of a packed base.

name: Merchant Module
description: Stacking this module increases the storage capacity of a walker's Cargo container.

name: Craftsman Module
description: Stacking this module decreases the crafting time of stations attached to a walker.

name: Fireproof Module
description: Lowers the damage from all fire sources for the walker and all structures.

name: Armoury Module
description: Stacking this module increases the capacity of a walker's Armor and Weapons container.

name: Hardening Module
description: Stacking this module reduces damage to a walker from all sources except those that can damage Reinforced armor.

name: Forager Module
description: Walker legs will automatically harvest foliage when travelling at slow speed. Stacking this module increases the amount of foliage harvested.

name: Scavenger Module
description: Walker legs will automatically pick up dropped items when travelling at slow speed. Stacking this module increases the maximum speed at which items are picked up.

name: Lumberjack Module
description: Walker legs will chop wood when they impact with trees. Stacking this module increases the amount of wood.

name: Pack Speed Module
description: Decreases the time it takes to pack bases and structures.

name: Hearth Module
description: Stacking this module decreases the water cost of respawning on walker.

name: Lifeforce Module
description: Nomads that respawn on a walker will recieve a beneficial status effect. Stacking this module increases the potency of this effect.

name: Bullrush Module
description: Stacking this module decreases the wait time before respawning on a walker.

name: Sandy Module
description: Stacking this module increases the rate at which sand is removed from a walker's gears after travelling.

name: Fortress Module
description: Stacking this module increases the armor value of all structures attached to a walker.

name: Harpoon Protection Module
description: Makes tethers attached to the walker easier to snap.

name: Battery Module
description: Stacking this module increases the torque battery's maximum capacity.

name: Torque Module
description: Walker will generate torque. Stacking this module increases the amount of torque generated by a moving walker.

name: Watery Module
description: Stacking this module decreases the water cost of travelling.

name: Pack Mule Module
description: Stacking this module increases the maximum weight limit of a walker.

name: Tube Spade
description: Used for harvesting resources from the soil, it is the simplest and most efficient way of digging in the ground that the great minds of the Flotilla could come up with.

name: Defensive Tower
description: Build weapons on the tower to protect your territory. Relatively cheap and easy to build.

name: Bomb Chest Trap
description: Looks like a normal chest, feels like an explosion. Booby trap this chest with any type of bomb.

name: Trap Door
description: Opens automatically when a nomad steps on it. Deadly in combination with other traps, like spikes.

name: Sharp Spikes
description: Sharp spikes that stick out of the ground deal serious damage to nomads who fall or step on them.

name: Spring Spikes Trap
description: Automatically stabs nomads with hidden spikes when they step on the trigger plate.

name: Trip Wire Trap
description: Triggers a small explosion when a nomad steps on the tripwire.

name: Barrier Base
description: Obstructs walkers from passing through.

name: Giant Wall Packer
description: (CAN BE BUILT ONLY BY CLAIM OWNERS) Large structure allowing Nomads to pack their Giant Wall defenses in a single compartment. Can only be built on bases and packed together with Founder Walkers due to its weight and size.

name: Giant Wall
description: (CAN BE BUILT ONLY BY CLAIM OWNERS) Sturdy walls of a massive size used by groups of nomads to defend their territory against walker attacks. Can be packed into a Giant Wall Packer.

name: Raptor Sky Walker Legs (1 of 2)
description: Special landing gear for Sky Walkers, allowing to soften the blow.

name: Raptor Sky Walker Wings (1 of 2)
description: Wings powered by torque that flap like those of flying creatures.

name: Sawblade
description: A mechanical arm with a spinning saw blade attached to it harvests lumber from a distance. Requires torque while sawing.

name: Long Sawblade
description: A mechanical arm with a spinning saw blade attached to it harvests lumber from a distance. Requires torque while sawing.

name: Walker Packing Compartment
description: Enables walker to pack other walkers into special compartments attached to the hull.

name: Steering Levers Cage
description: Sturdy contraption made of strong wood and tight ropes, allowing Nomads to place it around Walker Steering Levers to protect their driver.

name: Tool Pod
description: A rotating pod made to attach below walker decks. Houses a single tool, like a saw blade.

name: Walker Climber
description: A buildable attachement that helps yank nomads onto a walker's deck for quick and easy boarding.

name: Crane
description: Pick up and move heavy objects like firefly walkers and tree logs.

name: Kite
description: Fly a large kite above your walker and climb it for a better vantage point, or to launch wingsuits from. Walker must be moving for the kite to stay elevated.

name: Camelop  Walker
description: Being able to pump water and lava out of lakes, while storing large amounts of liquid, makes this walker an essential tool in various mass productions. Uses torque to move and while pumping.

name: Nomad Walker
description: A pedal-powered walker used by nomads for short range transportation. Boasts a spacious inventory and can pack up to three individual structures.

name: Proxy Walker
description: The proxy walker is designed to establish a protectorate over an oasis by deploying into an unmovable claim, provided that its owner possesses an official proxy license from the Flotilla. Can only be deployed while an oasis is unclaimed or contested and only becomes the claimant after no other deployed proxy walkers are left standing.

name: Raptor Sky Walker
description: Using a technology discovered during an expedition to a city in the sky, the Raptor Sky Walker is the first of its kind created by Nomads. Allows to soar in the sky like a leaf on the wind using torque for flapping its wings.

name: Bouldercut Hand Axe
description: It is said the axe earned its reputation after the tribe that invented them reportedly dug through a mountainside to escape the scorching sun.

name: Wyndan Hammer
description: Flotillan scholars claim that the Wyndan tribe has roots as a prominent civilization that existed long before the apocalypse.

name: Wyndan Sabre
description: The Wyndan tribe is said to have pioneered the first walkers.

name: Nibiran Hand Axe
description: Relics like these now decorate the homes of wealthy Flotillan capitalists, or are given as commendations to nomads who have significantly furthered the Flotillan cause.

name: Nibiran Curved Dagger
description: The miraculously thin blade slips between the fibers of armor. Allegedly used by the Guardian's royal assassins.

name: Nibiran Hammer
description: Nibiran weapons come from unknown origins, and have not been seen in battle for some time.

name: Wyndanblade Quarterstaff
description: Long ago, the Wyndan tribe mediated a lasting peace between the plains people. Today, they serve the Guardians as peacekeepers and engineers.

name: Ironblade Quarterstaff
description: Metal is rare, even on the battlefield. Most nomads can't comprehend how sharp an iron blade is until they are cut with one.

name: Nibiran Quarterstaff
description: After it was made in secrecy for one of the wealthiest weapon collectors on the Flotilla, the schemes for this quarterstaff appeared on the market. The few who wield it have seldom lost in combat.

name: Bouldercut Battle Axe
description: It is said the axe earned its reputation after the tribe who invented them reportedly dug through a mountainside to escape the scorching sun.

name: Wyndan Warhammer
description: Flotillan scholars claim that the Wyndan tribe has roots as a prominent civilization that existed long before the apocalypse.

name: Wyndan Flame Sword
description: The Wyndan tribe is said to have pioneered the first walkers.

name: Nibiran Battle Axe
description: Surrounded by brigands who sought to take his life, Punparratju swung his wicked axe and severed five of their heads in a single stroke. Punparratju's offensive to recapture the land bridge was successful, and the Flotilla crossed the straight unimpeded.

name: Nibiran Warhammer
description: Pops heads like little grapes. The nibiran minerals used to forge this weapon radiate a faint greenish glow.

name: Nibiran Decapitator
description: Traditionally used in the past for public executions on the Flotilla, until a master craftsman discovered the schematics and manufactured a few more. A feared sword with a dark history.

name: Balang Walker
description: Founder Walker type of the smallest size and least protection. Allows to pack and carry a base made of heavy solid materials.

name: Buffalo Walker
description: Before the Flotilla grew too large and switched to manpower, hundreds of buffalo walkers were used to tow the Flotilla on days there was no breeze. Named after an ancient beast, the buffalo's wide frame, ample deck space, and good maneuverability make it suited for almost any task.

name: Cobra Walker
description: Mobile shooting tower operated automatically with wooden machinery that shoots enemy weapons nearby. Requires deployment to shoot, which blocks its steering.

name: Dinghy Walker
description: Before the nomadic Flotillans had become aware of the route they needed to take to circumnavigate the planet efficiently, many of them died in the process of locating safe passage. These crudely constructed wind-powered walkers were first devised as scouting vessels because of their cheap cost and the high likelihood that a Nomad would not return. This walker has ample deck space for two Nomads.

name: Domus Walker
description: Heavily protected with strong walls all around, Domus Walkers are often used to safely transport large numbers of nomads. While slow and difficult to handle, they can withstand massive damages, ensuring structural integrity during battles and defending everything inside.

name: Falco Walker
description: It's streamlined shape is built for speed, making it a favorite among pirates. It's elevated deck doesn't sport much space for large weapons, but it's height allows for easy boarding of other walkers. Dedicated rear-facing spots for Gun Pods make it easy to fire projectiles at pursuers.

name: Hercul Walker
description: Capable of producing mass quantities of torque by heating up water with lava, Hercul Walker is an essential tool for any Nomad requiring large amounts of power. Will generate torque over time while holding its water container above a lava lake.

name: Hornet Walker
description: Devised by worm hunters who needed a sturdy walker with a low center of mass so they would not be toppled over, and a high top speed to outrun the giant beasts.

name: Mollusk Walker
description: Small cabin of the walker provides protection to possessions and the driver. While walls may let a nomad live longer, obstructed view from inside the cabin could be a serious drawback in a battle. Has a decent deck and good movement capabilities.

name: Panda Walker
description: Large walker carrier capable of storing up to 5 walkers of any size and hauling them, providing they're not too heavy. Limited deck size allows to build some weapons for protection.

name: Schmetterling Walker
description: One of the oldest walker designs, the schmetterlings provided mobile homes that an entire family could live on while chasing after the temperate climate. A large cargo hold affords tons of cargo space, and a wide open deck provides enough room for nomads to stretch their legs and build freely. The heavy weight of the schmetterling makes it less maneuverable.

name: Silur Walker
description: Founder Walker type of moderate size and protection. Allows to pack and carry a base made of heavy solid materials.

name: Spider Walker
description: A pedal-powered walker most nomads build to begin their journey on. Has an additional seat in the back with a built-in ballista!

name: Stiletto Walker
description: Developed as the successor to the dinghy walker, the sleek stiletto walker is fast, has a short turn radius, and flaunts more deck space and a stronger hull than its predecessor. Ideal for nomads who prefer to travel alone or in small groups.

name: Titan Walker
description: An iconic walker distinguished by tiered design and open, flat deck spaces. Dozens of large weapons can be stationed on it, but without a crew it's not very defensible.

name: Toboggan Walker
description: The standard merchant's vessel built for outrunning pirates and getting the goods where they need to go. There's not much room for weapons, so this walker is usually accompanied by at least one battle-capable walker on its transport runs.

name: Tusker Walker
description: Enough deck space for both large weapons and the crew needed to operate them. The tusker walker is a juggernaut when it comes to hauling space, and is primarily used by rich traders that need to transport tons of valuable goods. Slow and hard to maneuver, it's often escorted by swift combat walkers. Owners of tusker walkers rarely fail to get a return on their investment.

name: Bombolt
description: Used in Tower Walker weapon. Essentially a harpoon with a bomb on its tip that has devastating damage, but low accuracy due to the shape.

name: Bone Bolt
description: Ammo for Ballista. Bone tips are notorious for splintering and ricocheting inside the body.

name: Bone Harpoon
description: Ammo for Ballista. Easily penetrates and latches into wood. A strong tether holds it in place.

name: Cluster Bomb
description: Ammo for sling or catapult. Spawns dozens of tiny explosions covering a large surface area. Very effective at disrupting walkers and nomads on the ground.

name: Catapult Boulder
description: Ammo for catapult. This massive boulder obliterates bodies and smashes wood to bits.

name: Ceramic-Tipped Bolt
description: Ammo for Ballista. Ceramic tips guarantee their sharpness and strength.

name: Ceramic-Tipped Harpoon
description: Ammo for Ballista. Tether to any target and reel in until the harpoon is destroyed or the tether snaps.

name: Chalk Bomb
description: Ammo for sling or catapult. Releases thick smoke cloud in area. Does not deal any damage.

name: Chitin Shard Bolt
description: Ammo for Ballista. Naturally serrated shards of chitin make fine, if terrifying, tips for bolts.

name: Chitin Harpoon
description: Ammo for Ballista. Tether to any target and reel in until the harpoon is destroyed or the tether snaps.

name: Bone Dart
description: Ammo for Stingers and Repeater. Tipped with a sharpened piece of bone, it will shatter inside the target.

name: Chitin Dart
description: Ammo for Stingers and Repeater.  Tipped with razor-sharp shards of chitin, this small bolt can cause some nasty wounds.

name: Crane Harpoon
description: Ammo for Ballista. Tether to any target and reel in until the harpoon is destroyed or the tether snaps.

name: Explosive Bolt
description: Ammo for Ballista. Explodes on impact, slightly damaging and throwing back everyone in the affected area.

name: Explosive Dart
description: Shot with Repeater and Exoskeleton. Explodes on impact, damaging everyone in the affected area.

name: Fire Bomb
description: Ammo for sling or catapult. Primitive explosive detonates on impact, releasing lava and setting fire to its surroundings.

name: Fire Dart
description: A small dart covered in chunks of sulfur and other flammable substances. Good for setting stuff on fire.

name: Floating Mine
description: Shot with Repeater and Exoskeleton. After being shot, starts slowly falling down vertically, exploding on impact with anything. Creates a wall of mines when shot repeatedly.

name: Green Death Bomb
description: Ammo for sling or catapult. Explodes on impact, releasing a toxic cloud. The poison acts extremely quickly and does consistent damage.

name: Aloe Goo Bomb
description: Ammo for sling or catapult. Covers nomads in green goo that heals them for short duration.

name: Fire Bolt
description: Ammo for ballista. Designed to burn down wooden structures over multiple minutes.

name: Hellfire Bolt
description: Ammo for ballista. Designed to burn down wooden structures over time. A heavy bolt with a crushing bone head, designed to splinter walkers and light wooden structures.

name: Hardened Hellfire Bolt
description: Ammo for ballista. Burns quicker while dealing the same damage to the target as a Hellfire Bolt due to its structural properties. Much more difficult to destroy.

name: Hullbreaker Scattershot
description: Ammo for scattershot gun. Blows apart wooden constructions while also dealing some damage to sturdier materials.

name: Insect Bomb
description: Nomads attacked by a swarm of insects have to fight back. Insects will break grappling hook tethers and deal moderate health damage.

name: Iron Rok
description: Ammo for the Rokker. The pinnacle of hull-piercing ammunition, short of the largest of boulders.

name: Iron-Tipped Harpoon
description: Ammo for Ballista. The fishing titanium head refuses to come unhooked. A durable tether is hard to snap.

name: Net
description: Ammo for net thrower. Entangles small structures, mannable weapons, walker legs and wings.

name: Nibiran-tipped Bolt
description: Ammo for ballista. During an eclipse, these bolts will light up the sky and make enemies glow from the inside out.

name: Obsidian Rok
description: Ammo for the Rokker. A solid chunk of obsidian fashioned into a terrifying projectile.

name: Flint Dart
description: Ammo for Stingers and Repeater.  Weak and crude, best suited for hunting Phemke and unarmored Nomads.

name: Rupu Bone Javelin
description: A crude javelin made out of sharpened bone used by the Rupu to damage walkers.

name: Rupu Bomb Javelin
description: A volatile projectile used by the Rupu Raiders to damage walkers.

name: Rupu Rock
description: Ammo for Rupu Sling. Rupus refuse to throw anything else.

name: Scattershot
description: Ammo for scattershot gun. A mixed bag of blunt and sharp debris that spread out when fired.

name: Small Boulder
description: Ammo for slingshot. Deals higher damage the more tension there is on release.

name: Flint Bolt
description: Ammo for Ballista. Effective against lightly armored nomads.

name: Flint Rok
description: Ammo for the Rokker. Slow but powerful, it is devastating against walkers.

name: Flint Harpoon
description: Ammo for Ballista. Tether to any target and reel in until the harpoon is destroyed or the tether snaps.

name: Sulfur Bomb
description: Ammo for sling or catapult. Releases a short duration sulfur cloud on impact that deals health as well as corrosive durability damage.

name: Feather Boots
description: Thick feather-padded soles mitigate fall damage.

name: Fiber Sandals
description: Worn by nomads who toil in the Flotilla's underbelly, these itchy fibers may only protect against a sunburn.

name: Baskwood Boots
description: A heavy armor issued to Flotillan servicemen whose responsibilities range from reconnaissance, expiditionary planting, and trade station operation and disassemblement.

name: Rupu Fur Sandals
description: Worn by nomads who don't mind the smell. Extremely light and maneuverable.

name: Forester's Sandals
description: Provides average protection and meanueverability.

name: Triple Stitch Boots
description: A secret weaving technique creates surprisingly strong armor with no loss in meanueverability.

name: Carapace Boots
description: Layers of tough hides are sewn together into a heavy armor worn by the most seasoned nomadic fighters.

name: Lightwood Padded Boots
description: The Swampwood tribe rarely make contact with the Flotillans or venture beyond their fleet, making the specialty armor they construct from lightwood a sought after commodity.

name: Fiber Arm Wraps
description: Worn by nomads who toil in the Flotilla's underbelly, these itchy fibers may only protect against a sunburn.

name: Baskwood Bracers
description: A heavy armor issued to Flotillan servicemen whose responsibilities range from reconnaissance, expiditionary planting, and trade station operation and disassemblement.

name: Rupu Fur Sleeves
description: Worn by nomads who don't mind the smell. Extremely light and maneuverable.

name: Forester's Sleeves
description: Provides average protection and meanueverability.

name: Triple Stitch Bracers
description: A secret weaving technique creates surprisingly strong armor with no loss in meanueverability.

name: Carapace Gauntlets
description: Layers of tough hides are sewn together into a heavy armor worn by the most seasoned nomadic fighters.

name: Lightwood Padded Bracers
description: The Swampwood tribe rarely make contact with the Flotillans or venture beyond their fleet, making the specialty armor they construct from redwood wood a sought after commodity.

name: Gas Mask
description: Protects the wearer against gases if worn correctly, but needs to be replaced regularly. Surprisingly easy to breath through.

name: Fiber Headwrap
description: Worn by nomads who toil in the Flotilla's underbelly, these itchy fibers may only protect against a sunburn.

name: Cloak
description: Medium cloak designed to protect nomads from harsh wind gusts full of sand. A mixture of lightwood from the lands of Kali and worm silk left behind by roaming Long Ones.

name: Balaclava
description: Perfect for all the wrongdoers and outlaws. Fully conceals one's identity but also makes him or her clearly an individual to avoid.

name: Ruffian mask
description: Makes recognition of another flotilla citizen harder so various miscreants use it to unconfinedly perform their mischievous deeds.

name: Sunset headdress
description: Fiberwork crown used in the most illustrious Flotilla social ceremonials.

name: Bucket helmet
description: Carefully install this contraption on your braincase and display a wide assortment of still emotions.

name: Squared eyepatches
description: Odd-looking eyepatches partially disguising wearer's identity.

name: Ornate veil cap
description: Decorated leatherwork cap covering wearer's eyes.

name: Mask and eyepatch
description: Mostly used to ease up breathing during sandstorms. The eyepatch is purely for the show-off, however some nomads claim they're using it in a more purposeful manner.

name: Feather mask
description: Once part of Rupu accountrement, now adopted by upper-caste citizens in shamanic rituals.

name: Tied keffiyeh scarf
description: Used by nomads as protection from the burning sun and the all-present sand.

name: Wrapped keffiyeh scarf
description: Used by nomads as protection from the burning sun and the all-present sand.

name: Rupu mask
description: Intimidating and ostentatious - exactly what every nomad thirsts for.

name: Festive Turban
description: Embroidered turban typically worn by flotilla's elder community during various festivities and celebrations.

name: Durable Water Sack
description: Carry large volumes of liquid. Essential for water traders.

name: Bone Bottle
description: A bottle with an aftertaste.

name: Ceramic Flask
description: Ceramic items are difficult to make and usually seen as a mark of quality craftsmanship.

name: Foraging Pouch
description: Designed to store a lot of fiber and organic materials, including sediments, like sand.

name: Torque Backpack
description: Enables nomads to transport torque between various devices. The belt also significantly increases the effectiveness of grappling hooks.

name: Compacted Torque Battery
description: Infused battery allowing to store significant amounts of torque at a cost of extreme weight.

name: Improvised Bottle
description: While it doesn't hold much liquid, it's simple to make and can be crafted using almost any material.

name: Heavy Backpack
description: Loads of new inventory space.

name: Large Gathering Pouch
description: Holds a lot more fiber than its predecessor.

name: Infused Obsidian Bottle
description: A large container made of obsidian with nibiran coating. Withstands very high temperatures.

name: Obsidian Flask
description: Incredibly durable flask resistant to highest temperatures.

name: Makeshift Bottle
description: It's a wonder this little bottle can even stay glued together.

name: Medium Backpack
description: Grants additional inventory space.

name: Net Pouch
description: Spacious pouch with compartments for storing throwing nets.

name: Schematic Bag
description: A crude, lightweight leather bag that makes carrying bundles of scrolls much easier.

name: Light Backpack
description: A little extra inventory space to carry the bare necessities.

name: Split Bone Bottle
description: A small bottle with two seperate containers that can each hold a different type of liquid.

name: Split Ceramic Flask
description: A large bottle with two seperate containers that can each hold a different type of liquid.

name: Torque Battery
description: Stores torque by winding up a mechanism with a rope inside.

name: Wingsuit
description: Nomads are accustomed to leaving their fate to the winds. While some Nomads have managed to stay airborn for long periods of time and can perform nimble landings, many drop like a leaf.

name: Firework 1
description: Shoots a firework with a circular, colorful explosion.

name: Firework 3
description: Shoots a firework with a cylindrical, colorful explosion.

name: Firework 4
description: Shoots a firework with a colorful, double-sphere-like explosion.

name: Firework 5
description: Shoots a firework with a colorful, radial explosion.

name: Firework 6
description: Shoots a firework with colorful, killin-shaped explosion.

name: Firework 7
description: Shoots a firework with a colorful, sparkling explosion.

name: Flare - white
description: Fires an illuminating projectile high in the air that is visible from a long distance. The primary function is position signaling.

name: Flare - red
description: Fires an illuminating projectile high in the air that is visible from a long distance. The primary function is position signaling.

name: Flare - green
description: Fires an illuminating projectile high in the air that is visible from a long distance. The primary function is position signaling.

name: Flare - blue
description: Fires an illuminating projectile high in the air that is visible from a long distance. The primary function is position signaling.

name: Flare - orange
description: Fires an illuminating projectile high in the air that is visible from a long distance. The primary function is position signaling.

name: Flare - purple
description: Fires an illuminating projectile high in the air that is visible from a long distance. The primary function is position signaling.

name: Flare - teal
description: Fires an illuminating projectile high in the air that is visible from a long distance. The primary function is position signaling.

name: Advanced Pickaxe
description: A nearly unbreakable, highly efficient mining tool.

name: Beltless Grappling Hook
description: Doesn't benefit from torque, but more efficient than other grappling hooks when travelling without a torque belt.

name: Fiber Shirt and Trousers
description: Worn by nomads who toil in the Flotilla's underbelly, these itchy fibers may only protect against a sunburn.

name: Baskwood Armor
description: A heavy armor issued to Flotillan servicemen whose responsibilities range from reconnaissance, expiditionary planting, and trade station operation and disassemblement.

name: Rupu Fur Armor
description: Worn by nomads who don't mind the smell. Extremely light and maneuverable.

name: Bone Pickaxe
description: Mine stone and other minerals at higher efficiency with this bone tool.

name: Fast Grappling Hook
description: Superior reeling speed, but limited reach. Most effective in combat situations.

name: Repaired Grappling Hook
description: Grapple to any object, reel in and swing. An essential tool for any nomad who wants to live long enough to see the next oasis.

name: Torch
description: The nomads travel where the land is always bright, but eclipses will cause periods of unexpected darkness.

name: Long Grappling Hook
description: Gets a Nomad places others can't reach. Slower reeling speed may be disadvantegous while fighting.

name: Cloaked Rupu Fur Armor
description: A little added protection, with a little more smell. Still very light and maneuverable.

name: Forester's Armor
description: Provides average protection and meanueverability.

name: Brittle Bone Armor
description: The flexible bone plates are stitched into a scalemail that provides increased protection.

name: Triple Stitch Armor
description: A secret weaving technique creates surprisingly strong armor with no loss in meanueverability.

name: Carapace Armor
description: Layers of tough hides are sewn together into a heavy armor worn by the most seasoned nomadic fighters.

name: Lightwood Padded Armor
description: The Swampwood tribe rarely make contact with the Flotillans or venture beyond their fleet, making the specialty armor they construct from redwood wood a sought after commodity.

name: Wanderer's Potion
description: Forget everything you know about yourself. Resets stats of your character and returns all points.

name: Tablet
description: Carved images of animals can be felt on this tablet.

name: Random Knowledge Tablet
description: Utilizing a mixture of glass, shattered fragments, and crystals from meteor cores, the Flotillans have devised new ways of producing and distributing knowledge tablets.

name: Fragment
description: Faint images are etched on the translucent surface.

name: Purified Water
description: All water that is transported to the Flotilla is cleansed in an ancient water purifying machine. The Guardians are the sole keepers of this machine, a technological relic of the old world which has sustained the Flotillans to this day.

name: Shattered Fragment
description: A shattered fragment - some simple information can still be extracted, but without some restoration work it's hard to learn about complex topics from it.

name: Worm Sand
description: Appearing in the sands roamed by the Old Ones - giant worms of the desert, this substance has strange properties affecting both living creatures and mechanical constructions in ways that affect the energy inside them.

name: Worm Silk
description: Worm silk exists in vastly different tensile strengths and purities, and must be graded by the Flotillan Merchant's Guild before it can be legally sold at markets. Aside from certain prohibited substances, it is one of the most desirable luxury goods.

name: Animal Fat
description: A greasy leftover from a once noble creature.

name: Bone Splinter
description: Flexible bones make excellent tools and armor.

name: Worm Fang
description: A trophy of tremendous value proving the ultimate hunting skills and heroism among Nomads. Exchange for valuable rewards!

name: Scaffolding
description: A stackable, elevated platform that allows for easier access to high places. Useful in walker construction.

name: Master Pickaxe
description: Mine minerals with increased efficiency.

name: Scythe
description: Returns a superior yield when used to harvest small plants.

name: Simple Pickaxe
description: Mine stone and other minerals with this crude tool.

name: Simple Repair Hammer
description: Repair wings, legs, and any other structures by hammering them. Always cheaper to fix than to rebuild.

name: Simple Sickle
description: Returns a good yield when used to harvest small plants.

name: Automaton
description: A remote-controlled mechanical tool that can handle mounted weapons.

name: Nurrfang Toothclub
description: Clubs lined with sharp fangs are terrifying weapons used by the most aggressive Nomad tribes.

name: Rawbone Club
description: Razor-sharp bone splinters stick out of the shaft, punching holes in unprotected flesh with every strike.

name: Rawbone Hand Axe
description: Nomads quickly learned that sharpened chunks of sun-dried bone are quite useful for chopping things.

name: Crude Hatchet
description: A roughly chipped piece of stone hastily tied to a stick. Will chop a few trees down, but don't expect it to last.

name: Heavy Rawbone Hand Axe
description: Heavier than its counterpart, but the intelligence required to wield it is still low.

name: Rawbone Scimitar
description: Rawbone weapons are favoured by many Nomad tribes for its connection to the beasts of the land.

name: Firestone Axe
description: With its sharp edge and a balanced handle, a Firestone Axe is a choice of many Nomads seeking reliable and powerful weapons for their battles.

name: Firestone Bludgeon
description: Reinforced by solidified lava, bluedgeons are often brought back to the Flotilla by the Nomads who dare to explore volcanic areas.

name: Jaggertooth Club
description: A weapon that is deeply symbolic of nomadic culture, straddling the line between barbarism and innovation.

name: Advanced Hatchet
description: Even the most obstinate nomad has fun chopping food with this extremely efficient tool.

name: Short Ceramic Hoofmace
description: The hoof-shaped handle is attributed to the wandering Herdsmen Tribe, who are now lost, but are fabled to have found The Place That Never Dies. The hoof is a good luck charm among Nomads who are forever at the whim of the path they follow.

name: Short Malletblade
description: The blunt force behind the blade makes it cut much deeper than other swords.

name: Stone Axe
description: Nearly all nomads are expert carpenters, and the hatchet is essential to their way of life.

name: Beat Stick
description: The fastest way to dispatch a rupu.

name: Rawbone Quarterstaff
description: They call nomads who specialize in using rawbone weaponry "boneheads," an ancient term meaning simpleton.

name: Firestone Hammerstaff
description: While not being sharp like a similarly built bladestaff, the weight and sturdyness of hammerstaff tips allows to crack enemy skulls with ease and grace.

name: Firestone Bladestaff
description: Nomads wielding hot bladestaffs made of processed lava have become legendary in some parts of the world for their unique combat techniques and strength.

name: Blunt Quarterstaff
description: This unflattering weapon may just look like rocks tied to a stick, but it's deceptively powerful in the hands of a skilled nomadic warrior.

name: Travellers Staff
description: While nomads no longer travel on foot to make their migration across the world, there exists a deep affection for the old ways. The tradition of converting walking staffs for battle has yet to die.

name: Paddleblade Quarterstaff
description: Adorning the backs of Swampwood tribe's most adept warriors, this bladed quarterstaff doubles as a paddle while canoeing the misty shores of the South Sea.

name: Firebomb
description: Lightweight obsidian ball containing highly flammable mixture. Throw it at enemies to deal fire damage.

name: Bomb Javelin
description: The Nomad that came up with the innovative idea of attaching a bomb to a stick was rewarded with a large walker by the Flotilla for their contribution to science.

name: Heavy Javelin
description: While short spears were found to be cumbersome in boarding actions, their stopping power when thrown proved useful for fighting bigger kinds of the Rupu.

name: Light Javelin
description: The first Throwers were members of a rogue sect of cannabilistic warriors. Their numbers have waned, but they still periodically cause havoc for Flotillan supply caravans.

name: Throwing Net
description: A portable net with a release mechanism that allows to throw it by hand.

name: Throwstone
description: Either a fantastically aerodynamic stone, its form perfected for best throwing experience... Or just a sharp chip of rock that you can throw at someone in a pinch.

name: Rawbone Battle Axe
description: Rawbone weaponry doesn't take half a brain to make, but it will split your enemies in half.

name: Rawbone Maul
description: They call nomads who specialize in using rawbone weaponry "boneheads," an ancient term meaning simpleton.

name: Long Bonespike Swordstaff
description: Bonespike weapons are favoured in the Flotillan arena for their brutality.

name: Rawbone Sawsword
description: A symbol of status among many Nomad tribes,  the Sawsword is valued for its devastating damage.

name: Firestone Battleaxe
description: Sharpened using an ancient Nomadic technique, the blade of a Firestone Battleaxe just as easily cut heads as trees.

name: Firestone Bozdogan
description: While the excquisite craftsmanship of the bozdogan weapons draws attention of many, their weight distribution allows only the strongest warriors to wield it effectively.

name: Firestone Longblade
description: Pulsating with heat of a firestone, longblades have become a popular weapon among Nomad warriors who can afford their high price.

name: Jaggertooth Maul
description: A weapon that is deeply symbolic of nomadic culture, straddling the line between barbarism and innovation.

name: Jaggertooth Swordclub
description: The serrated flint blade is designed to inflict the utmost pain, without necessarily being lethal. The preferred weapon of many pirates.

name: Long Ceramic Hoofmace
description: The hoof-shaped handle is attributed to the wandering Herdsmen Tribe, who are now lost, but are fabled to have found The Place That Never Dies. The hoof is a good luck charm among Nomads who are forever at the whim of the path they follow.

name: Singblade
description: Supossedly one of the only weapons devised by the Guardians themselves, who are rumored to be master engineers. The blades whistle in a pleasant way as they cut through the air.

name: Battle Fan
description: Recent Flotillian invention allows nomads to manipulate the air by sucking and blowing. Although created to move and store gas clouds, it can also push nomads as well as a walker it's built on using a powerful Superblow.

name: Gun Pod
description: A rotating pod made to attach below walker decks. Houses a single weapon.

name: Gun Pod Shell
description: Attach a light shell of armor to the gun pod to make it safer from attack.

name: Gun Pod Plating
description: Attach heavy armor plating to the gun pod to make it safer from attack.

name: Gunpod Stinger
description: Miniature version of a ballista that fits inside a gun pod.

name: Hose Station
description: Push hostiles off your walker with a powerful jetstream. Also useful for cooling down molten lava.

name: Net Thrower
description: Launch nets to temporarily entangle small structures, mannable weapons, and other objects.

name: Rokker
description: A heavy weapon that launches deadly roks. Invented out of necessity when various Nomad factions started fielding large Walkers against each other.

name: Rupu Sling
description: Tied down rupu that throws specially made rupu rocks at intruders. Precise and deadly when the target is close, but very wasteful at longer distances, making it a perfect defense inside a base.

name: Scattershot Gun
description: Fire a short-range barrage of sharp stones in a wide angle. Effective against personnel and weak structures.

name: Stinger
description: Small Ballista for remote control while steering. Needs to be reloaded manually.

name: Medium Stinger
description: A Small Ballista that can be remotely controlled by the driver, placed on a rotating platform.

name: Tall Stinger
description: A Small Ballista placed on a raised arm that lets the driver get better firing angles.

name: Ballista
description: Ballista shoots bolts or tethering harpoons that attach to walkers and the environment.

name: Catapult
description: Launches boulders and bombs extremely far distances. Effective against fortified structures.

name: Repeater
description: Unload a rapid volley of darts that are deadly against lightly armored targets. Weak against walkers and structures.

name: Slingshot
description: Launch small rocks and bombs moderate distances. Don't hit your own deck!

name: Proxy License
description: A permit to build one proxy walker to claim an oasis.

name: Worm Scale
description: The corpse of a single worm can provide enough meat to feed a large family for months; its hard scales can be used to craft armor; its silk makes the sturdiest sails, its sinew the strongest rope; and its blood, when imbibed, heightens the users olfactory senses to supernatural levels.
